column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0105] As described above, the connection manager 322 handles the accepting and making of requested connections in electronic message transactions.

#Text=The dispositions described above can be implemented by the connection manager 322 by manual configuration through the administrative console 316, or they can be automatically implemented by the interpreter process 350 or another software module.
#Text=As with the process of FIG. 8, the practice of the process illustrated in FIG. 9 is not limited to the specific steps set forth therein.
#Text=Thus, a greater or lesser number of steps may be employed.
#Text=Additionally, steps having greater or lesser detail than those illustrated in FIG. 9 may also be employed to advantage.
#Text=[0106] Looking now at FIG. 10, illustrated is an operational flow diagram 1000 of the interpreter process 350, which was also generally described in the text accompanying FIGS. 3-4.
#Text=Execution of the process flow for the interpreter process 350 begins at step 1002, which is the sleep state for the process.
#Text=After a certain period of time, e.g., fifteen seconds, execution of the program flow moves to step 1004.
#Text=At step 1004, the EMS 203 configuration is updated for all the organizations for which the EMS 203 is responsible.
#Text=This process may be referred to as "synchronization."
#Text=At step 1006, the interpreter process 350 begins to analyze the traffic events occurring for each organization identified in step 1004.
#Text=As a part of this action, the EMS 203 evaluates the traffic events occurring as reflected in the data stored in the traffic monitor 340.
#Text=[0107] The process flow continues at step 1010, where the EMS 203 evaluates the event conditions for the particular EMS 203 event rule for the organization under consideration.
#Text=At decision step 1012, the interpreter process 350 software queries whether the particular rule is an active one.

#Text=If the rule is not active, the process flow goes to decision step 1014, whereupon the software module queries whether there are more EMS 203 event rules to be processed for the particular organization.

#Text=If there are no further EMS 203 event rules for the particular organization, the process flow proceeds to decision step 1016, at which the software module queries whether there are additional EMS 203 organizations for which the EMS 203 events should be processed.
#Text=If there are no additional EMS 203 organizations to process, the software module returns operation to the sleep mode at step 1002, which was the beginning of this process flow.

#Text=If, however, there are additional EMS 203 organizations having EMS 203 event rules to be processed, then operation would return to step 1006, at which the software module will again begin the process of evaluating the EMS 203 traffic against the EMS 203 event rules for this other organization.
#Text=[0108] Again at step 1010, the event conditions are evaluated against each EMS 203 event rule.
#Text=If, in this case, at decision step 1012 the rule is active, the software flow would proceed to step 1020.

#Text=At step 1020, the interpreter process 350 evaluates each traffic cell, where a traffic cell is a single connection between a source and a destination, and is represented in the traffic monitor 340 by a single cell in the data table 504.

#Text=At decision step 1022, if a positive result of the evaluation of the particular traffic cell at step 1020 is positive ("result greater than one"), then execution of the interpreter process 350 algorithm continues to decision step 1024.
#Text=At decision step 1024, the rule state is evaluated to see whether it has previously been triggered.
#Text=If it has not, at step 1026, the event execution is begun.
#Text=If the rule state has already been triggered, then execution of the event will continue at step 1028.
#Text=In either case operation continues at step 1030, at which time a process is begun for "firing" the actions that are associated with particular event states.
#Text=[0109] At decision step 1032, the interpreter process 350 queries whether that particular action associated with the event already has a state associated with it in the process execution.
#Text=If no, the interpreter process 350 then queries whether the particular action should be delayed at decision step 1034.
#Text=If the action should not be delayed, at step 1036, the particular action is "fired" and a state is set indicating the activation of that action.
#Text=Next, at decision step 1038, the interpreter process 350 queries whether there are additional actions to fire.
#Text=If so, execution returns to step 1030; in this loop, steps 1030 to 1039 continue until all actions associated with a particular event have been processed.

#Text=Once there are no more actions to "fire" at step 1038, execution proceeds to decision step 1040, whereupon the interpreter process 350 software examines whether there are more traffic cells to be evaluated.
#Text=If there are additional traffic cells to evaluate, the process returns to step 1020.
#Text=If there are no more traffic cells to evaluate, the process returns to decision step 1014, at which it is determined whether there are additional EMS 203 rules to be processed.
#Text=Based on this decision, the process can continue at previously described steps 1010 or 1016.
